name: Mamucium: Roman Manchester — Roeder's Plan (c.1900)
description: Archaeological reconstruction plan of the Roman fort at Mamucium (Castlefield), drawn c.1900 by Charles Roeder. Shows Roman fort outline, roads, and settlement features overlaid on the modern street plan. NOT a Roman-era map — a modern archaeological reconstruction based on excavation evidence.
notes:
MODERN RECONSTRUCTION — NOT a Roman-era map.
Drawn c.1900 by Charles Roeder (Fecis. C. Roeder), showing Roman fort outline and features overlaid on modern streets.

Flickr direct: https://www.flickr.com/photos/manchesterarchiveplus/15254452907/in/album-72157628617413397
Flickr album: https://www.flickr.com/photos/manchesterarchiveplus/albums/72157628617413397/with/6593195247

Charles Roeder (1848-1911): German-born Manchester antiquarian who excavated Mamucium 1899-1906.
Published 'Roman Manchester' (1900) with plans of the fort.
This plan shows his interpretation of the fort layout based on his excavations.

No high-res institutional digital source found (checked UoM LUNA, Manchester Digital Collections, GMAU).
Best source for archaeological plans: 'Roman Manchester: The University of Manchester's Excavations within the Vicus 2001-5'.
Contact UoM Special Collections (uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk) or Manchester Archives+ for digitised plans.
GMAU excavation report: http://www.gmau.manchester.ac.uk/pdfs/rmc1.pdf
